thread.title: Selling banks ‘will not cut national debt’
thread.title_full: Selling banks ‘will not cut national debt’

title: Selling banks ‘will not cut national debt’
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Selling banks ‘will not cut national debt’ The Lloyds and RBS sales are likely to raise £38 billion Leon Neal/AFP/Getty Images Philip Aldrick Published at 12:01AM, September 10 2015 
The government will not be able to use the proceeds of privatising Royal Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Banking Group to reduce the national debt because the funds will be needed elsewhere, according to a public spending watchdog. 
The National Audit Office has analysed forecasts for all the incomings and outgoings of Britain’s state-backed financial institutions and established that the taxpayer will be £200 million out of pocket over the lifetime of the present parliament. 
The chancellor announced plans to raise £38 billion from RBS and Lloyds share sales by 2020, on top of which he expects to recover £33 Subscribe now
